name: FUNC | Daily Scheduler | Inactive Supplier Workflow
description:
This recipe automates the process of retrieving and processing inactive supplier data from the SAP Ariba API and updating the corresponding records in an Oracle database.

- The process is triggered daily at 8:00 AM.
- It makes an HTTP request to the SAP Ariba API to fetch inactive supplier data that has been updated since a specified time.
- If supplier data is returned, it parses the JSON response to extract vendor details.
- For each vendor, it checks if the vendor already exists in the Oracle database. If not, it inserts the vendor's information into a staging table and executes a stored procedure to update the supplier's status.
- After processing, it asynchronously notifies stakeholders about the supplier synchronization status.
- If any errors occur during the process, an error handling recipe is called to log the error details and notify the relevant team.

Overall, this recipe ensures that inactive suppliers are accurately tracked and updated in the Oracle system, facilitating better supplier management.

block.name: search_rows_sql

input.sql:
SELECT
    CASE 
        WHEN APS.END_DATE_ACTIVE IS NOT NULL THEN 1 
        ELSE 0 
    END AS result
FROM APPS.AP_SUPPLIERS APS
WHERE APS.GLOBAL_ATTRIBUTE14 = :ARIBAVENDORID

extended_input_schema.hint: First provide the full name assigned to your bind variable in the WHERE condition. e.g. id Second, provide the actual parameter value. Parameter values can be static or datapills. Select the closest corresponding data type that your database is expecting for the bind variable
extended_input_schema.label: Parameters
extended_input_schema.name: parameters

block.comment: Check for END_DATE_ACTIVE filled in AP_SUPPLIERS Table
